This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

EasyPrivacy requests:

** If a site implements any tracking or monitoring, UA/IP/Geo checks, browser detection, analytics, telemetry, linking to third-parties, pixels, referrers, fingerprinting, event/perf logging etc. Regardless how helpful or needed the script(s) are, it will be blocked in EasyPrivacy. Any additions, changes, or removals is at the authors' discretion.

To avoid being banned, don't constantly re-open or create new (related) issue reports.
-->

`mediamarkt.de`

#### What happens?

Visiting `www.mediamarkt.de` will send dns queries to 1.1.1.1 (Cloudflare DNS).

comment.body:
@jordansworlddd https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/208338#issuecomment-3012793393
You missed that two important things:
1. The website's language is Korean. So regardless of what it can reproduce or not, you need to enable List-KR filters list.
2. The reporter used Chrome web browser (desktop version; not mobile) with AdGuard MV3 browser extension.

issue.title: Clean parked domains in AdGuard cookie filters list

labels.name: Infrastructure
labels.description: Related to the repository infrastructure

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer; - [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed; - [x] This is not an ad/bug report. ### Problem description The [parkedDomain2](https://github.com/List-KR/parkedDomain2) reports that the following domains are parked:
List

veggiepeople.org dewelt.de tolubisz.eu recipestravelworld.com flavourecipes.com doremizone.com find-clever.de helpsetup.ru snbc13.com motornk.com worldmangas.com enginepassion.com animesonlinegames.com hashflare.io allfreeapk.com ratengoods.com techgara.com leech360.com adpop.me kumanda.tv storytel.com.tr allonlinestore.in tvplusnewtab.com curiouscat.me chrome-portable.com eand.co mycard2go.com

### Proposed solution Check each domain and remove if it is actually parked. ### Additional information https://github.com/List-KR/parkedDomain2


comment.body:
> No traffic
> 
> ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/300cf9c5-fa50-40e4-bef2-80054cd0d9eb)
> 
> Please check similar sites on https://pro.similarweb.com/#/digitalsuite/home If no data or low traffic (less even that 30k per month), there is no point in adding.

Probably, since the previous domain name was added as a rule, then we can say that it was complying with the required visitor rule. But the important issue now is - when was the domain name replaced with a new one. If it was changed within a few days, it is normal to have no traffic. For example, most of the famous TV series sites such as dizipal can show low traffic numbers when changed to a new name.

russianbeauties.jp kagekidan.net topitane.net boosting-site.com omosoku-r.com gamers-luck.com spoilerplus.net chara.ge raincaptcha.com mangarawjp.onl nukeruerodouga.com tifer2.jp klmanga.org moro-ai.com pandachirari.com panchiragazo.com paipan-holic.com mhw-matome.com erodougameijin.com valorantchannel.net majav.org kaigainohannou.info bucchinews.com kichimamasenki.com creative.live mioyamazaki.jp dosukebe.site life-hack.xyz ero-mangacafe.com eromenskan.com psneolog.com anonelife.com gadget-log.com rentalcgi.com sai-kurashi.com more-gamer.com kabooo.net longamerikastock.com shiroutoav.net connecnect.com nectarineple.com antennash.com mcnt.jp

comment.body:
Any of the reported ones except "Online Malicious URL Blocklist" (even when all the others are switched off). I'm also on the macOS beta 26, so Safari version is 26 as well.
No problem at all when opening in Chrome though, so it has to be something about the Safari browser itself, not the macOS.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
Not reproduced with AdGuard filters on my end.
Try to leave only them, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
If they monitor our changes, then of course rules will stop working (not the first website which is doing something like that, though usually they do not list rules).

You can add to user rules:
```adblock
||nontonx.com^$replace=/if \(!passedd\(\)\)/if(!1)/,document
nontonx.com#%#//scriptlet('trusted-replace-node-text', 'script', 'getComputedStyle', 'if (!passedd())', 'if(!1)')
```
it should works until they will change something again.

comment.body:
With the above rules, ads are still sort of making it through: only the text is visible, image gets block. 
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/51921499-b4ed-4b2d-b908-50387e222675)

Interestingly I tested on chrome and the ads are blocked as normal:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c5d5a5f5-778c-4979-b1f7-873892d921bd)
Looks like this is only an issue with Firefox for now
